>> Why is something like 
>> assert foo != null : "Foo null";
>> a bad thing?

> if the condition if false, an AssertionError will be thrown.  Your 
> method will then be exited immediatly.
> 
> If no class catches the error, your program will simply exit 
> (and if you  have written your code with 1.1, 1.2 or 1.3 it 
> will be the case).  It is the right way to deal with a null 
> argument?  I don't think so.

What do you think is the right way?
subject: RE: [junit] Experience with jdk1.4 assert keyword
